messages.title: Hardworking, Experienced, Local
messages.content: I've been proud to have been an accessible and hardworking local MP since you elected me in 2015. It’s an honour to represent the area where I live. I'm born in Withington Hospital, went to school and university locally, and have always lived and worked here. Being a politician, I've worked in the community – as an event manager and DJ. I've been active in our community for many years – as a school governor at two local schools, as a Housing Trust board member, and member of local community groups. I served locally as a City Councillor for Old Moat ward. As lead Councillor for Education, I led the rebuilding of our local schools under a Labour Government, and I also took a lead on regeneration issues and the campaign for jobs for our area. Public service is of great value to our staff. But I also had to deal with the incredibly difficult decisions forced on us by this Tory/Lib Dem Coalition. The only way to stop them is a strong Labour Party in parliament, fighting for a fairer society.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Proper pay rise for nurses, rebuild and scrap car parking charges for hospital visits.
Support for Women Against State Pension Inequality.
Fight funding cuts for our schools, propose a “hard Brexit”, support the NHS, support our Police, campaigning for a greener Britain.
Cuts to every school in south Manchester, return of grammar schools, return of foxhunting, tax cuts for corporations and the wealthy.

issues.education: Fight funding cuts for our schools, lead Councillor for Education, rebuilding of our local schools.
issues.government: Had to deal with the incredibly difficult decisions forced on us by this Tory/Lib Dem Coalition.
issues.health: Fighting for our NHS, proper pay rise for nurses, rebuild and scrap car parking charges for hospital visits.
issues.lawCrime: Support our Police, more police on our streets.
issues.socialWelfare: Supporting WASPI Women, supporting Women Against State Pension Inequality.

community.content: Active in the community for many years – as a school governor, Housing Trust board member, and member of local community groups.

leaflet.personalStatement: I've been proud to have been an accessible and hardworking local MP since you elected me in 2015. It’s an honour to represent the area where I live.

politicalExperience.achievements: Dealt with over 10,000 enquires in just two years.

politicalExperience.role: City Councillor for Old Moat ward
politicalExperience.achievements: Led the rebuilding of our local schools under a Labour Government.
Took a lead on regeneration issues and the campaign for jobs.

endorsements.endorsement: Jeff is a strong voice for south Manchester in parliament, and I know he shares my concerns on homelessness, mental health and housing. I'm looking forward to working with him as your MP to tackle these issues.
Jeff helped me sort out a problem with my Tax credits and did a great job.
I couldn't get any help with my problem until Jeff personally intervened.

quotes.text: I voted against triggering article 50 in February because it wasn’t in the interests of my constituents. I'm proud to be Labour, to be part of the Labour team in parliament, but I will always put the interests of south Manchester residents first.

images.caption: Working For You All Year Round

examples: Dealt with over 10,000 enquires in just two years.
93% of the votes when he was an MP in the previous parliament.
Weekly local advice surgeries and over 25,000 people have been invited to his 'meet your MP' coffee mornings.
Proud to represent the area where I live.

Public service is of great value to our staff.

personalStories.story: Born in Withington Hospital, went to school and university locally, and have always lived and worked here.

examples: Andy Burnham endorsing Jeff Smith's concerns on homelessness, mental health and housing.
Mr. Blume's endorsement on sorting a problem with Tax credits.
Emily Flanagan's endorsement about solving a personal issue.
The Lib Dem candidate voted with the Tories in 93% of the votes when he was an MP in the previous parliament. The Lib Dems are no alternative.
